verses.verse: Dead <S%H4194><s%> flies <S%H2070><s%> cause the oil <S%H8081><s%> of the perfumer <S%H7543><s%> to send forth <S%H5042><s%> an evil odor <S%H887><s%>; so doth a little <S%H4592><s%> folly <S%H5531><s%> outweigh <S%H3368><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and honor <S%H3519><s%>.
A wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s heart <S%H3820><s%> is at his right hand <S%H3225><s%>; but a fool <S%H3684><s%>'s heart <S%H3820><s%> at his left <S%H8040><s%>.

Yea also <S%H5530><s%>, when the fool walketh <S%H1980><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%>, his understanding <S%H3820><s%> faileth <S%H2638><s%> him <S%H559><s%>, and he saith to every one that he is a fool <S%H5530><s%>.

If the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the ruler <S%H4910><s%> rise up <S%H5927><s%> against thee <S%H3240><s%>, leave not thy place <S%H4725><s%>; for gentleness <S%H4832><s%> allayeth <S%H3240><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> offences <S%H2399><s%>.

There is <S%H3426><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, as it were an error <S%H7684><s%> which proceedeth <S%H3318><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the ruler <S%H7989><s%>:
folly <S%H5529><s%> is set <S%H5414><s%> in great <S%H7227><s%> dignity <S%H4791><s%>, and the rich <S%H6223><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> in a low place <S%H8216><s%>.
I have seen <S%H7200><s%> servants <S%H5650><s%> upon horses <S%H5483><s%>, and princes <S%H8269><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> like servants <S%H5650><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%>.

He that diggeth <S%H2658><s%> a pit <S%H1475><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> into it <S%H6555><s%>; and whoso breaketh through a wall <S%H1447><s%>, a serpent <S%H5175><s%> shall bite him <S%H5391><s%>.
Whoso heweth out <S%H5265><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> shall be hurt <S%H6087><s%> therewith <S%H1234><s%>; and he that cleaveth wood <S%H6086><s%> is endangered thereby <S%H5533><s%>.

If the iron <S%H1270><s%> be blunt <S%H6949><s%>, and one do not whet <S%H7043><s%> the edge <S%H6440><s%>, then must he put <S%H1396><s%> to more strength <S%H2428><s%>: but wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is profitable <S%H3504><s%> to direct <S%H3787><s%>.
If the serpent <S%H5175><s%> bite <S%H5391><s%> before it is charmed <S%H3908><s%>, then is there no advantage <S%H3504><s%> in the charmer <S%H3956><s%>.
The words <S%H1697><s%> of a wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s mouth <S%H6310><s%> are gracious <S%H2580><s%>; but the lips <S%H8193><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> will swallow up himself <S%H1104><s%>.

The beginning <S%H8462><s%> of the words <S%H1697><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> is foolishness <S%H5531><s%>; and the end <S%H319><s%> of his talk <S%H6310><s%> is mischievous <S%H7451><s%> madness <S%H1948><s%>.

A fool <S%H5530><s%> also multiplieth <S%H7235><s%> words <S%H1697><s%>: yet man <S%H120><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not what shall be <S%H310><s%>; and that which shall be after him <S%H5046><s%>, who can tell him?
The labor <S%H5999><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> wearieth <S%H3021><s%> every one of them <S%H3045><s%>; for he knoweth not how to go <S%H3212><s%> to the city <S%H5892><s%>.
Woe <S%H337><s%> to thee <S%H776><s%>, O land, when thy king <S%H4428><s%> is a child <S%H5288><s%>, and thy princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>!

Happy <S%H835><s%> art thou <S%H776><s%>, O land, when thy king <S%H4428><s%> is the son <S%H1121><s%> of nobles <S%H2715><s%>, and thy princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in due season <S%H6256><s%>, for strength <S%H1369><s%>, and not for drunkenness <S%H8358><s%>!
By slothfulness <S%H6103><s%> the roof <S%H4746><s%> sinketh <S%H4355><s%> in <S%H8220><s%>; and through idleness of the hands <S%H3027><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> leaketh <S%H1811><s%>.
A feast <S%H3899><s%> is made <S%H6213><s%> for laughter <S%H7814><s%>, and wine <S%H3196><s%> maketh glad <S%H8055><s%> the life <S%H3701><s%>; and money answereth all things <S%H6030><s%>.

Revile <S%H7043><s%> not the king <S%H4428><s%>, no <S%H4093><s%>, not in thy thought; and revile <S%H7043><s%> not the rich <S%H6223><s%> in thy bedchamber <S%H2315><s%>: for a bird <S%H5775><s%> of the heavens <S%H8064><s%> shall carry <S%H3212><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%>, and that which hath <S%H1167><s%> wings <S%H3671><s%> shall tell <S%H5046><s%> the matter <S%H1697><s%>.
